uncertainty_register.unknown: Incentive structure details—specific compensation formulas, performance review criteria, measurement systems by function
uncertainty_register.decision_impact: Cannot quantify precise incentive misalignment magnitude. Inferred sales compensated on bookings (not profitability), support measured on SLA (not resolution), operations measured on incident response (not prevention)—but specific formulas, weightings, thresholds unknown. Cannot assess incentive reform complexity: How many compensation structures need changing? How entrenched are measurement systems? What data infrastructure required for outcome-based measurement? Cannot predict personnel response to incentive changes: Would sales organization accept profitability-based compensation? Would support accept resolution-based measurement? Would operations accept prevention-based accountability?
uncertainty_register.what_would_reduce_uncertainty: Incentive structure disclosure: Sales compensation formulas (bookings weight, profitability weight, quota structures), Support performance review criteria (SLA weight, satisfaction weight, resolution metrics), Operations measurement systems (incident response metrics, prevention metrics, proactive investment allocation), Engineering performance criteria (feature velocity weight, operational stability weight, technical debt metrics), BU President compensation structure (P&L weight, cross-functional coordination weight), CEO compensation formula (financial results weight, organizational capability weight)

uncertainty_register.unknown: Accountability void resolution options—feasibility and risks of different structural reforms
uncertainty_register.decision_impact: Multiple accountability voids identified but unclear which resolution approach optimal. Deal profitability void: Create deal review board? Create CRO with sales/delivery authority? Grant BU Presidents deal approval? Each option has different feasibility/risks. Customer resolution void: Create VP Support? Create Customer Success organization? Grant support authority to compel cross-functional action? Each has different coordination costs. Cross-functional coordination void: Grant BU Presidents authority matching accountability? Create operating committee? Maintain CEO coordination but add capacity? Cannot assess which reforms feasible given capital constraints, organizational capability, cultural resistance. Cannot predict reform success probability: Would BU Presidents succeed with authority? Would operating committee resolve conflicts effectively? Would deal review board improve profitability or slow deal velocity?
uncertainty_register.what_would_reduce_uncertainty: Structural reform option analysis: Deal review board feasibility (resource requirements, decision velocity impact, sales organization resistance), CRO role definition (scope, authority, reporting, interaction with BU structure), VP Support role creation (authority scope, headcount requirements, cross-functional coordination mechanism), Operating committee structure (membership, decision rights, conflict resolution process), BU President authority expansion (scope, peer conflict resolution, enterprise optimization vs local optimization trade-off), Organizational change capacity assessment (capital available, leadership bandwidth, cultural readiness)

uncertainty_register.unknown: Execution drag quantification—magnitude of value destroyed by misaligned incentives and accountability voids
uncertainty_register.decision_impact: Drag patterns identified but value destruction magnitude uncertain. Sales drag creates margin erosion (Private Cloud -13%, Public Cloud -3%)—but how much margin erosion attributable to incentive misalignment vs market conditions, competitive pressure, cost inflation? Support drag creates customer satisfaction decline—but how much churn/revenue impact attributable to resolution failures vs product quality, competitive alternatives, market dynamics? Operations drag creates incident recurrence—but how much incident cost attributable to prevention underinvestment vs inherent technology risk, vendor dependencies, threat landscape? Cannot prioritize drag resolution by ROI: Which drag resolution delivers largest value recovery? Which reforms have highest ROI given implementation cost?
uncertainty_register.what_would_reduce_uncertainty: Drag value quantification: Margin erosion attribution (incentive misalignment contribution vs external factors), Customer churn analysis (resolution failure contribution vs other factors), Incident cost analysis (prevention underinvestment contribution vs inherent risk), Drag resolution ROI modeling (value recovery potential vs implementation cost for each reform option), Scenario analysis (how much value recovered if sales incentive realigned? If support measured on resolution? If operations funded for prevention?), Comparative analysis (other companies with similar challenges—what value recovery achieved through incentive/accountability reforms?)

uncertainty_register.unknown: Personnel capability to operate under reformed incentive/accountability structure
uncertainty_register.decision_impact: Accountability void resolution requires personnel capability uncertain. BU Presidents lack authority currently—if granted authority, do they have capability to coordinate cross-functionally? Support staff coordinate informally through heroics—if granted formal authority, can they compel cross-functional action effectively? Sales organization optimizes bookings currently—if incentivized on profitability, can they conduct profitability analysis competently? Operations team responds to incidents currently—if accountable for prevention, can they design/implement proactive controls effectively? Cannot assess whether structural reforms will succeed given current personnel capability. Personnel may need augmentation (hiring, training) simultaneously with structure reform—but capability assessment unavailable.
uncertainty_register.what_would_reduce_uncertainty: Personnel capability assessment: BU President coordination skills (can they negotiate peer conflicts, optimize enterprise vs local, manage cross-functional dependencies?), Support leadership capability (can empowered coordinator compel cross-functional action, resolve authority conflicts, prioritize effectively?), Sales profitability analysis capability (can sales organization assess delivery cost, negotiate value-based pricing, conduct buildability validation?), Operations prevention capability (can operations design proactive controls, prioritize prevention investment, measure prevention effectiveness?), Leadership bench strength (if current personnel lack capability, are successors available internally or require external hiring?), Organizational learning capacity (can organization develop new capabilities through training or require personnel turnover?)

uncertainty_register.unknown: Incentive reform implementation risk—transition costs and potential personnel attrition
uncertainty_register.decision_impact: Incentive reform necessary but transition risky. Sales incentive change from bookings to profitability creates short-term compensation reduction (fewer unprofitable deals booked)—sales attrition risk unknown magnitude. Support measurement change from SLA to resolution may reveal currently-masked underperformance—support morale/retention impact unknown. Operations accountability change from response to prevention may conflict with firefighting culture—operations resistance unknown. CEO incentive change from short-term financial results to organizational capability may conflict with Board expectations—CEO retention/Board support unknown. Cannot assess whether organization can absorb transition risk: Personnel attrition during transition, performance dip during learning curve, cultural resistance derailing reform, Board patience insufficient for multi-year reform. Capital constrained ($1.3B debt)—limited financial capacity to absorb transition costs (retention bonuses, performance dip, reform program cost).
uncertainty_register.what_would_reduce_uncertainty: Transition risk assessment: Personnel attrition probability by function (sales risk from comp changes, support risk from measurement changes, operations risk from accountability changes), Retention cost modeling (bonuses/comp adjustments required to maintain key personnel during transition), Performance dip magnitude and duration (how much business impact during learning curve? How long until reformed structure delivers value?), Cultural resistance assessment (which functions/leaders will resist reform? What change management required?), Board patience assessment (will Board accept short-term performance cost for long-term capability building?), Capital availability for transition (how much investment required? Can absorb within debt constraints?)

uncertainty_register.unknown: Post-close integration impact on incentive reform feasibility
uncertainty_register.decision_impact: Incentive/accountability reforms necessary but acquirer integration approach will determine feasibility. If acquirer integrates fully (consolidates functions, imposes acquirer processes): Rackspace incentive reforms irrelevant—acquirer systems will replace. If acquirer operates Rackspace autonomously (standalone subsidiary): Rackspace reforms feasible but acquirer may not fund transition costs. If acquirer cherry-picks assets (retains profitable segments, exits unprofitable): Reforms may be preempted by asset sale/closure. Cannot plan incentive reforms without knowing acquirer integration strategy. Investment in pre-close reforms risky—may be wasted if acquirer replaces systems. But failure to reform pre-close may reduce enterprise value—acquirer values stable business not broken incentive structure requiring acquirer investment to fix.
uncertainty_register.what_would_reduce_uncertainty: UNKNOWABLE—depends on future acquirer integration strategy. Can model scenarios: (1) Full integration—Rackspace incentive reforms irrelevant, (2) Autonomous operation—Rackspace reforms critical, (3) Asset sale—reforms may not recover investment. But cannot predict which scenario until acquirer identified and integration approach negotiated. Pre-close reform investment decision must consider scenario probabilities and value at risk in each scenario.
